There's a fundamental flaw (well, more than one actually) in the theory that homosexuality is a choice: Why would anyone choose to be gay in a society that discriminates against gays so fervently? Why would that person choose to love someone he/she couldn't marry?

post_info.post_title: Why the theory that homosexuality is a choice doesn't work
